BLOOMINGTON, INDIANA, 1*71*0$

Mr. James A. Fellows, Assistant Director
Research and Development
National Association of
Educational Broadcasters
131*6 Connecticut Avenue, N. W.
Washington, D. C., 20036
Dear Mr. Fellows:
This letter deals with the Region III NAEB Conference at Indiana Univer¬
sity on March 22, 23, and 21*. I hope you will be able to send me your
reactions to what follows in this letter as soon as possible.
The theme for the conference is to be, as we agreed in Milwaukee
’’Education^ Stake in Radio and Television.11
There will be two formal addresses, the first at 9 a.m., Monday morning,
March 235 the second after a banquet on Monday evening. Plans now are
to hold a general luncheon at 12 noon or 12:30 p.m. on Tuesday, March 21*,
to conclude the conference. This may concern itself with summaries and/or
resolutions, if the conference feels it necessary or wise to issue such
resolutions.
General structure of the conference may be as follows:
Sunday. March 22
3 p.m. to 6 p.m. — Registration and tours
8 p.m. — Information from NAEB Headquarters followed by
questions and information from the membership.
9 p.m. — Studio presentation of television news program
Monday. tfarch 23
